intro: Trichospermum incaniopsis, commonly known as the silverleaf thornapple, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy, silver-gray leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by spherical, fuzzy fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it drought-tolerant. Its leaves and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
